comments:
I seem to get this only when I change a certain property on some of my parts.  
It seems that org.eclipse.swt.custom.TableTree.getItem(Point) is returning a 
disposed widget for some reason.

Which build are you using?

Moving to SWT, as your assumptions appears to be correct.  The
Tree.getItem(Point) in the mouseDown listener must be returning a disposed item,
which should not be possible.

PropertySheetViewer was changed to use a Tree with columns, rather than
TableTree, back in January.  Which build are you running?
Could you please try with 3.1 RC3?

Was going to try reproducing the problem in 3.1 release, but have the 
following breaking changes when trying to switch from 3.1M4 to 3.1 release: 
-the method getString (String) is undefined for the type WorkbenchMessages 
(used for sharing text/tooltips with eclipse commands - should this be done 
another way?)

-implementors of IEditorSite must implement inherited abstract method 
IWorkbenchPartSite.getPart(), IEditorSite.registerContextMenu(String, 
MenuManger, ISelectionProvider, boolean), IEditorSite.registerContextMenu
(MenuManager, ISelectionProvider, boolean)

-cannot open document to test because of bug 102186

The first two are API violations.  WorkbenchMessages is internal, and
IEditorSite is marked as not to be implemented by clients.

What strings are you trying to obtain via WorkbenchMessages?

Why do you need to implement IEditorSite yourself?

Should file separate bugs for each of these against Platform UI if you feel that
we're missing API required for your scenario.

With respect to WorkbenchMessages, we're trying to obtain the localized 
strings Eclipse is using for things 
like 'Delete', 'Undo', 'Redo', 'Cut', 'Copy', 'Paste', etc.  We use them to 
set the text and tooltips on our Actions that perform these things.

As for why we're using IEditorSite, I'll have to look into it.
TableTree is deprecated.  Please reopen if you can make this happen in 3.1.

Still a problem in 3.1 Release:

Here's a stack trace for the same problem in 3.1 Release.  This time, it's 
tree.getItem (Point) that's returning a disposed widget (PropertySheetViewer 
line 754) that is being used (PropertySheetViewer line 756).

What I am doing to cause the error is:
1. Select a property in the Properties view (uses a combobox cell editor)
2. Change the property to a different value
3. Commit the property change by clicking off of the property onto another 
property.

Note that this seems to only occur for some specific property changes, not 
all...

We aren't having this issue any more in 3.2.

Should we close the bug?

I'd also check Eclipse 3.3 M4 or HEAD to see if the problem is gone for 3.3.  Lots of code changed in this area between 3.1 and 3.2 and it is quite possible this bug was fixed.

If the problem is back in 3.3, please reopen this bug report.
